One of the greatest and influential games of all time, Half-Life 2 will be a historical reminder to games companies of how to make a great sequel.
The game has aged well, and there is a VR version to be released soon. This game has also one of the most dedicated fanbases I have ever seen, along with the dedicated modding community.
half-live to przestarzała ale nadal jara gra folecam wszystkim bo naprawde fajna

[h1]Alberick on an retro-shooter journey, pt.1[/h1]

Considering the first game I've ever played on PC (and instantly fell in love with) was "Doom II" back in 1994*, the amount of my personal exposure to classic FPS games can only be 
described as brief. Naturally, growing up in a post-communist state had something to do with it, as poor access to goods considered necessities in Western Europe, unfortunately, didn't allow us Polish kids to benefit from the then latest technology. The Internet was unheard of, computers and game consoles were scarce (most of them were imported and they cost 2-3 monthly wages) and most of us relied on this one acquaintance whose parents could afford a Sega or a Pegasus back then and we would take every chance to pay him a visit. And if somebody had a PC, he was the most popular kid in town. When I finally laid my hands on a Commodore 64 (and later on an Amiga 1200) I was on cloud nine. However, these computers weren't exactly renowned for their FPS catalogue.** 

That brings me to today, as I've recently rediscovered my forgotten penchant for strafing, shooting and rocket-jumping and since, to cut the story short, I've always wanted to experience what was so groundbreaking about the "Half-Life" series. Both the original installment (brilliantly reworked as "Black Mesa") and the sequel were the obvious candidates for the perfect games to mark the onset of my retro-shooter journey.

As it turned out, I couldn't have chosen anything better (and I claim this despite having to choose from such venerated classics as “Quake”, “System Shock”, “Blood” or “Duke Nukem”), solely for the fact that “Half-Life 2” is much closer to what modern shooters look like and it aged well enough, even when it comes to graphics. This upper hand of a decade (“HL2” came out in 2004) would surely constitute an easy entry point for anyone interested in discovering or revisiting an oldschool FPS. Especially, knowing that this series borne such mods (now stand-alone games) as “Team Fortress” or “Counter-Strike”, which are definitely not considered to be outdated.

Generally speaking, “Half-Life 2” is incredible. The gameplay, the guns, the story, the enemies, the characters, the level design and its diversity – I could go on like this for some time (and I'm writing this only after being a couple of hours into the game). [b]Still, the thing I wanted to find out was why this game was so innovative or influential. And the answer to this question is “it wasn't”, however, it didn't have to be. :) So why did it have such a profound impact on the gaming industry?[/b] There were a few games which previously introduced numerous “Half-Life's” key ideas, so there goes innovation... but what was so special about Valve's game was that all those ideas (even if imitative of previous titles) just played together extremely well. Thus, [b][u]the strength of the game lay not in being forward-thinking but in meticulous enhancement of all of the available pieces and getting them to work together in an exquisite manner[/u][/b], therefore, creating a gold standard for a generation of future first person shooters. And if the original game had been extraordinary, the sequel (and its expansions) became the true paragons of how to make timeless, engaging and challenging computer entertainment.

Still, I think [b]“Half-Life 2” is more than just a terrific sum of its parts. And I wouldn't do it enough justice if I didn't mention that [u]the series in fact laid the groundwork for an oftentimes overlooked feature. Namely, it seamlessly incorporated the story into your progress.[/u][/b] That is, before “Half-Life” one would watch a cutscene (or a scripted animation on a game's engine) at the beginning and at the end of a level. Valve changed this, and thanks to them our games became more integrated, more cinematic, and more engrossing.

As the summary should by quite succinct, let me just say that if you're still having doubts, just do yourself a favor and immerse yourself in this early-2000s jaw-dropping gem of a game.




[i]* Here I should definitely thank my father (who's not a gamer by any means) for introducing me to “Doom II”. More precisely, introducing me to a young seaman who installed the game on one of the ship computers, and allowing me to spend days in front of it. It was in the early 90s, I was around 7 years old and me and my mother visited dad in Hamburg (which was the closest European port he would sail to so that we could see him during his six-month cruise) and I used to have nightmares because of that game. I would play it in the morning anyway. :)

** The only FPS I played then were the reputed “Gloom” (CDS Software, 1995) (which was the best Amiga could do to imitate Doom and the likes) and Polish take on the genre called “Cytadela” (“Citadel”, Arrakis Software 1995). I've got fond memories of both of them. I also recall quite a mediocre game titled “Death Mask” (Alternative Software, 1994) and RPG-inclined “Hired Guns” (Psygnosis, 1993), the latter of the two receiving a cult following among some older players, although I didn't understand its success, being under 10 and not comprehending English at the time.[/i]
The best FPS I've ever played

Half-life 2 - легендарная игра, которая потрясла мир в далеком 2004 году своей физикой, графикой и атмосферой. Кстати о графике, даже в 2019 году она выглядит хорошо, особенно вода, но на задники лучше внимание не обращать. Если вы не прошли её в свое время и думаете покупать ли hal-life2, то берите не раздумывая.
Einfach legendär dieses Spiel. Muss man gespielt haben.
Игра из тех времен когда Вавл делала игры а не кейсы и игры модификации.

Half-Life 2 спустя годы отлично играется: графика на высоком уровне, геймплей будто завораживает, история увлекает. Научная фантастика про учёного, который использует голову для решения задач, а между делом - ураганный экшн.
Если кто-то по какой-то причине не играл в неё, когда она вышла и на протяжении всех этих лет, то не упускайте возможность: берите и не пожалеете!
10 из 10 на кончиках пальцев
Халф лайф это одна из величайших игр, даже спустя 6 лет смотрится свежо, стрельба, физика, сюжет. В это лучше поиграть.
Don't buy this game, it's probably the worst fps out there. 10/10
